newsitem.title: USA: Spectrum says new game meets strong demand.
newsitem.headline: Spectrum says new game meets strong demand.

text.p: Spectrum HoloByte Inc, a developer of PC games, Wednesday said its new game "X-COM: Apocalypse", is beating sales expectations at retail stores.
The company has shipped 120,000 units in the United States, Europe and Asia since its launch on July 15.

"The game has sold through over half of its initial orders in two major US retail outlets. (It) is exceeding the expectations of the retail channel," Derek McLeish, senior vice president, said in a statement. "X-COM: Apocalypse has been on the shelves under a week and we have already received strong US and UK re-orders."
